abstract: Will health reform include an independent Medicare commission worthy of the name?
snippet: Will health reform include an independent Medicare commission worthy of the name?
lead_paragraph: Economists say that one of the most important pieces of health care reform is an independent commission to help set Medicare payment rates. The best hope for creating a serious version of such a commission may be Senator John D. Rockefeller IV, the West Virginia Democrat.

headline.main: Rockefeller: The Economists’ Man in the Senate?

abstract: An economist proposes four ways to control health care costs without resorting to having the government dictate who gets what treatments.
snippet: An economist proposes four ways to control health care costs without resorting to having the government dictate who gets what treatments.
lead_paragraph: Dana P. Goldman is the Norman Topping Chair in Medicine and Public Policy and director of the Leonard D. Schaeffer Center for Health Policy and Economics at the University of Southern California.

headline.main: I Am a Death Panelist. I Am Not the Problem.
